content.p: The Nottingham Advantage Award (NAA) gives you the opportunity to develop essential life and work-based skills, through the completion of extracurricular modules. It helps you develop the ability to reflect on the skills you've gained through learning activities, workshops, or your current tasks, allowing you to identify these skills and effectively showcase them to employers when applying for jobs. While participating in modules, students have the opportunity to: There are a range of module types from those containing work experience and workshops, self-directed learning modules, and modules that are designed to accredit work that you are already doing such as a part-time job or peer mentoring. Find out more and apply for 24/25 modules Read Asmita's blog: Why I think you should do the NAA Watch more videos with previous participants The NAA is for all registered undergraduate and postgraduate students and researchers at the University of Nottingham, looking to develop skills, gain experience and meet new people. Go to the NAA Homepage in MyCareer, then: Call us on 0115 846 8159 telephone: +44 (0) 115 951 3680 fax: +44 (0) 115 951 3679 email: careers-team@nottingham.ac.uk
